name: places/ChIJPRAc6XVZwokRIFj3P465qvA
formattedAddress: 409 E 14th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 409 E 14th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text: I had a similar experience to a few others here on Zocdoc. Initially, the office had a good reputation, but when I visited, I was disappointed. The office was extremely dirty, and the smell of cigarettes and old lunch boxes was pervasive. I underwent several blood tests, for which I later received a bill. However, I never received any follow-up from Dr. Lawrence. Despite my attempts to reach out via email and phone calls, leaving messages, I have not received any callbacks. The email address he provided for availability seems to be inactive. This level of unprofessionalism is unbelievable, and I am still in the dark about the results of my blood tests.

originalText.text:
Had lots of blood tests taken for a pain condition and haven’t heard back since May. I have called the office regularly (and left messages) and emailed. Really odd. He seemed like a really awesome guy. Came for my physical and other stuff. Very nice and helped navigate insurance and billing codes as a doctor should. But I’m going to have to find a new doctor because Dr. Herbert ghosted me.

Update. He called me 2 months later. He was nice but this left a bad taste in my mouth overall. Will be switching doctors. He said he would be on top of helping me figure out my health issue but lacked follow up, communication, and interest. But I will make it clear he was always polite when we spoke.

originalText.text:
The worst doctor experience I’ve had. Office was dirty, smelled like cigarettes. Doctor was frantic and working all alone—front desk, all of it. I almost walked out, but I was just there for a physical so I figured why not just stay—it’ll be quick.

A very quick examination and he took blood. He promised he’d have the result to me in two days. It’s been a month. He remembered to bill my insurance, but hasn’t bothered to return my multiple calls asking for the results. I’m still waiting.

Avoid if you can.

originalText.text: awful communication skills and makes you feel like its your fault, needs to take on less patients as he no longer has any front office staff and is clearly overloaded and trying to do more work than hes capable of at the expense of his patient's experience

originalText.text: Dr. Herbert is great! I've seen him twice now for my annual physical. Very understanding and has great bedside manner. Booking my appointment was as straightforward as it could possibly be. I'd highly recommend.
